zoo.pipeline.api.torch package¶

Submodules¶

zoo.pipeline.api.torch.torch_loss module¶

class zoo.pipeline.api.torch.torch_loss.TorchLoss(criterion_bytes, bigdl_type='float')[source]¶

Bases: bigdl.nn.criterion.Criterion

TorchLoss wraps a loss function for distributed inference or training. This TorchLoss should be used with TorchModel.

static from_pytorch(criterion)[source]¶

zoo.pipeline.api.torch.torch_model module¶

class zoo.pipeline.api.torch.torch_model.TorchModel(module_bytes, weights, bigdl_type='float')[source]¶

Bases: bigdl.nn.layer.Layer

TorchModel wraps a PyTorch model as a single layer, thus the PyTorch model can be used for distributed inference or training. The implement of TorchModel is different from TorchNet, this TorchModel is running running pytorch model in an embedding Cpython interpreter, while TorchNet transfer the pytorch model to TorchScript and run with libtorch.

static from_pytorch(model)[source]¶

Create a TorchNet directly from PyTorch model, e.g. model in torchvision.models. :param model: a PyTorch model

to_pytorch()[source]¶

Convert to pytorch model :return: a pytorch model

zoo.pipeline.api.torch.utils module¶

class zoo.pipeline.api.torch.utils.DistributedSequentialSampler(dataset, num_replicas, rank)[source]¶

Bases: torch.utils.data.sampler.Sampler

A sequential sampler used in FeatureSet when get (train=false) iterator .

set_epoch(epoch)[source]¶
zoo.pipeline.api.torch.utils.trainable_param(model)[source]¶

zoo.pipeline.api.torch.zoo_pickle_module module¶

This module imports contents from CloudPickle in a way that is compatible with the pickle_module parameter of PyTorch’s model persistence function: torch.save and torch.load. TODO: remove this when PyTorch have compatible pickling APIs.
